problem.markdown:
Which of the following things are different in case of real gases than ideal gases?
[x] They do not obey [mathjaxinline]P v = R T[/mathjaxinline]. [x] They have their own equation of state. [x] The attractive forces in real gases are significant as compared to those in ideal gases.
problem.p: Which of the following things are different in case of real gases than ideal gases?

checkboxgroup.choice: They do not obey [mathjaxinline]P v = R T[/mathjaxinline].
They have their own equation of state.
The attractive forces in real gases are significant as compared to those in ideal gases.
